article.name: 2014-summer-intensives
article.title: 2014 Summer Intensives
article.description: At the end of the spring semester each year we offer several one-week courses on our campus. In 2014 we are offering: "Bonhoeffer in His Context" (College and Seminary level), "History of Christianity" (Seminary) and "Effective Ministry Management" (Seminary).
article.metaDescription: 2014 Summer Intensives, "Bonhoeffer in His Context" (College and Seminary level), "History of Christianity" (Seminary) and "Effective Ministry Management" (Seminary).

article.name: discussing-the-gospel-in-noah
article.title: BLOG: Don't Miss the Boat! Discussing the Gospel in Noah
article.description: To view or not to view? Most of the discussion swirling around the movie Noah seems to be missing the boat—literally. If believers are going to theaters simply to compare the cinematic story with the biblical story, then they probably needn’t bother. The director, a self-proclaimed...

article.title: CSBS&C Preview Weekend on March 14-15!
article.description: Attend a FREE weekend and receive a $100 tuition voucher! Learn more about our school, be refreshed spiritually, and enjoy great music in community.

article.description: Dr. Donald Sunukjian will be sharing on "The Book of James—No String of Pearls" on January 21-22 for our 2014 Academic Lectureship in memory of Dr. Garry Owen, M.D. Register today!

article.title: 2013 Missions Conference
article.description: CSBS&C will be hosting a Missions Conference on January 29-30 on "The World at our Door: Reaching Immigrants in North America." Invite others and join us for different sessions, including ethnic food samples on Tuesday evening!
